item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Source: Eli Manning, New York Giants agree to six-year, $97.5 million contract extension
item.description: Eli Manning has agreed to a new six-year, $97 million contract extension with the New York Giants that will make him the highest-paid player in the NFL with an average salary of roughly $15.3 million.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Dodgers tighten security after Prince Fielder's tirade
item.description: While Prince Fielder took batting practice at Dodger Stadium before Wednesday night's game, no fewer than nine stern-faced members of the ballpark's security staff maintained a vigilant presence outside the Milwaukee Brewers' clubhouse.

item.dc:creator: Chad Ford
item.title: Brandon Roy, Portland Trail Blazers agree to 5-year extension
item.description: The Portland Trail Blazers have reached an agreement on a five-year contract extension with guard Brandon Roy a league source told ESPN.com.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Pedro Martinez strikes out 11 in Double-A rehab start
item.description: Pedro Martinez recorded nine of his first 12 outs by strikeout and worked six innings for the Double-A Reading on Wednesday night, in what could have been his final rehab start before joining the Philadelphia Phillies.

item.dc:creator: James Walker
item.title: Braylon Edwards, of Cleveland Browns, practices for first time
item.description: Cleveland Browns receiver Braylon Edwards practiced for the first time in training camp Wednesday after the team took him off the Non-Football Injury List.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Damon homer, 3 RBIs power Yankees past Jays
item.description: Johnny Damon hit a solo home run and had three RBIs, Nick Swisher also connected and the New York Yankees completed a two-game sweep of the Toronto Blue Jays with an 8-4 victory Wednesday night.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Wife, mother recovering, Phil Mickelson glad to play
item.description: With his wife and mother recovering from breast cancer surgery, Phil Mickelson is happy to be back on the golf course.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Report: Kurt Rambis emerges as Minnesota Timberwolves top candidate
item.description: Kurt Rambis reportedly went to Minnesota and could be named the team's next head coach.

item.dc:creator: Pat Yasinskas
item.title: New Orleans Saints tackle report that Reggie Bush suffered setback
item.description: The Saints said that an earlier report that Reggie Bush left practice was incorrect.

item.dc:creator: Chad Millman
item.title: Judge sets date for Delaware betting trial
item.description: Leagues' early action to block sports betting from Delaware denied

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Mets lose Niese to injury, rough up Lohse, Cards
item.description: Nelson Figueroa pitched 4 1/3 scoreless innings and boosted the offense with a two-run triple after Jonathon Niese got hurt, leading New York over the Cardinals 9-0.
